page.title: 12Great Coxwell Church
page.content: The 12th century stone built church of St.Giles stands on high ground near the centre of the village.The church has an early 16th century brass to the Morys family.The churchyard is closed and burials take place in an adjacent piece of land.Heating was installed in 1979 and restoration work was carried out in 1982,mainly to a crack in the tower.At this time the exterior rend- ering was removed.There is a ring of 5 bells,regularly rung by the village bellringers.Rev.Robert Swanborough, vicar since 1980,also preaches at Coleshill,Buscot & Eaton Hastings.With diminishing congregations,he may not be replaced upon his retirement.
